TI Ground state in Sr3Ru2O7: Fermi liquid close to a ferromagnetic
   instability
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTOR SR2RUO4; SPIN FLUCTUATIONS; ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY;
   QUANTUM OSCILLATIONS; ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; LAYERED PEROVSKITE;
   BEHAVIOR; PRESSURE; SYSTEM
AB We show that single-crystalline Sr3Ru2O7 grown by a floating-zone technique is an isotropic paramagnet and a quasi-two-dimensional metal, as spin-tripler superconducting Sr2RuO4 is. The ground state is a Fermi liquid with very low residual resistivity (approximate to 3 mu Omega cm for in-plane currents) and a nearly ferromagnetic metal with the largest Wilson ratio R(W)greater than or equal to 10 among paramagnets so far. This contrasts with the ferromagnetic order at T-c = 104 K reported on single crystals grown by a flux method [Cao et al., Phys. Rev. B 55, R672 (1997)]. However, we have found a dramatic changeover from paramagnetism to ferromagnetism under applied pressure. This suggests the existence of a substantial ferromagnetic instability in the Fermi-liquid state.
C1 Electrotech Lab, Tsukuba, Ibaraki 3058568, Japan.

TI Specific heat and effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity of
   CePtGa single crystal
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 22nd International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1999
CL HELSINKI, FINLAND
SP Commiss C5 low Temp Phys, Int Union Pure & Appl Phys, Acad Finland, Helsinki Univ Technol, Int Assoc Promot Sci, Oxford Instruments Ltd, FortumCorp, Nokia Grp, Finnair Ltd, Datex Engstrom Ltd, Finnish Phys Soc, Picker Nordstar Ltd, Neuromag ltd, SAP Finland Ltd, Espoo Elect Ltd, Outokumpu Ltd, City Espoo, Finnish Acad Sci & Letters, DCA-Instruments Ltd, Vaisala Ltd
HO HELSINKI UNIV TECHNOL
DE antiferromagnetic ordering; effect of pressure; electrical resistivity;
   specific heat
AB Specific heat and effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity of CePtGa single crystal have been measured upto 30 kbar. A sharp peak in the ratio of specific heat to temperature and in electrical resistivity is observed at 33 and 3.5 K, respectively, which is ascribed to an antiferromagnetic transition. The results reveal that T-N decreases linearly with increasing pressure upto 30 kbar. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity of Ce3SnC single
   crystal
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 22nd International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1999
CL HELSINKI, FINLAND
SP Commiss C5 low Temp Phys, Int Union Pure & Appl Phys, Acad Finland, Helsinki Univ Technol, Int Assoc Promot Sci, Oxford Instruments Ltd, FortumCorp, Nokia Grp, Finnair Ltd, Datex Engstrom Ltd, Finnish Phys Soc, Picker Nordstar Ltd, Neuromag ltd, SAP Finland Ltd, Espoo Elect Ltd, Outokumpu Ltd, City Espoo, Finnish Acad Sci & Letters, DCA-Instruments Ltd, Vaisala Ltd
HO HELSINKI UNIV TECHNOL
DE antiferromagnetic ordering; effect of pressure; electrical resistivity
AB New ternary compound Ce3SnC has a simple Face-centered cubic CaO3Ti-type structure. We found that Ce3SnC undergoes a transition to an antiferromagnetic state at T-N = 7.0 K and the magnetization process shows multi-step metamagnetic transitions at T = 1.5 K. Tn this work, we present the effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity of Ce3SnC. The anomaly which originates from antiferromagnetic ordering is observed around T-N at 1 bar. The results reveal that T-N increases drastically with increasing pressure up to P = 23 kbar. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Precise resistivity measurement in PrInAg2 down to 50 mK
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 22nd International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1999
CL HELSINKI, FINLAND
SP Commiss C5 low Temp Phys, Int Union Pure & Appl Phys, Acad Finland, Helsinki Univ Technol, Int Assoc Promot Sci, Oxford Instruments Ltd, FortumCorp, Nokia Grp, Finnair Ltd, Datex Engstrom Ltd, Finnish Phys Soc, Picker Nordstar Ltd, Neuromag ltd, SAP Finland Ltd, Espoo Elect Ltd, Outokumpu Ltd, City Espoo, Finnish Acad Sci & Letters, DCA-Instruments Ltd, Vaisala Ltd
HO HELSINKI UNIV TECHNOL
DE non-Kramers doublet; PrInAg2; quadrupolar Kondo; resistivity
AB Resistivity of a Heusler-type intermetallic paramagnetic compound PrInAg2 is measured precisely down to 50 mK. An empirical equation is well determined as Delta rho proportional to + log T between 50 mK and 1 K. The system is expected as an example of the quadrupolar Kondo system, since the Pr3+ (4f(2)) ion in the material has a non-magnetic doublet ground state Gamma(3). The results are not consistent with Delta rho proportional to +/- T-1/2 Which is expected from the single impurity quadrupolar Kondo model near the ground state. (C) 2000 Published by Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Magnetic properties of a single crystal of the metamagnetic compound
   (Fe0.98Ru0.02)(2)P
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
DE iron diphosphide; Ru substitution; antiferromagnetism; metamagnetism;
   giant magnetoresistance
ID FE2P; PRESSURE
AB The magnetization and electrical resistivity of a single crystal of (Fe0.98Ru0.02)(2)P have been measured as a function of temperature from 5 to 300 K and in magnetic fields up to 5.5 T. The compound orders antiferromagnetically at T-N = 135 K and exhibits field-induced transitions to the ferromagnetic state in both principal directions. At 5 K, the magnetic moment along the c-axis is 2.9 mu(B)/f.u. after the transition. The transitions are accompanied by a giant magnetoresistance effect (Delta p/p > 25%), indicating a considerable reconstruction of the Fermi surface. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science S.A. All rights reserved.

TI Metamagnetic transition of CeRh2Si2 under high fields and high pressures
   at various temperatures
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE Kondo antiferromagnet; high-field magnetization; high pressure;
   metamagnetism
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
AB High-field magnetization measurements in a heavy fermion antiferromagnet CeRh2Si2 were performed under high pressures at various temperatures to study the nature of the metamagnetism. Metamagnetic transitions were observed not only in the antiferromagnetic state but also in the paramagnetic stale at various pressures, The metamagnetism in CeRh2Si2 does not originate from the rearrangement of antiferromagnetic moments but from the recovery of the local moment from the Kondo singlet state by applying high magnetic fields. (C) 2000 Published by Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Pressure-induced structural-phase transition of CeRu2
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE pressure effects; structural phase transition; electrical resistivity;
   X-ray diffraction
AB Electrical resistivity of cubic Laves-phase compound CeRu2, has been measured from 3 to 300 K under the quasi-hydrostatics pressure P from 1.5 up to 8 GPa. X-ray diffraction was performed :It room temperature under the pressure up to 15 GPa. Temperature dependence of electrical resistivity rho(T) shows no anomaly at pressures below 5 GPa and resistivity decreases with increasing pressure. However, rho(T) curves, measured under the pressure above 5.5 GPa. reveal an abrupt decrease at critical temperature T,. This indicates that a new phase is induced by the pressure. T, shows a large pressure dependence: Delta T-a/Delta P = 59.2 K/GPa. According to the X-ray data, the phase transition above 5.5 GPa is a structural-phase transition. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Magnetic properties of single crystal CePtGa
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE heavy fermions; Kondo compounds; CePtGa
AB Magnetic and transport properties are reported For the: first time on single crystal of CePtGa which is isostructural with the Kondo semiconductor CeNiSn. Magnetic susceptibility shows the Curie-Weiss behavior at high temperatures and an effective number of Bohr magneton for trivalent Ce ion and antiferromagnetic order was round below 3.5 K. TI Magnetic properties of Ce-3 TX compounds (T = Al, In, Sn and Pb; X = C
   and B)
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE metamagnetic transition; antiferromagnetic ordering; cerium compounds
AB We have synthesized new ternary compounds Ce3TX (T = Al, In. Sn and Pb, X = C and B) which have a simple face-centered cubic CaO3 Ti-type structure. Magnetization measurements were performed on Ce3TX compounds up to H = 5 T in the range of T = 2.0-300 K. For Ce3TC, we found antiferromagnetic orderings and metamagnetic transitions. For Ce3TC. anomalies which might be associated with structural phase transition were observed in magnetic susceptibilities. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Magnetoresistance in PrInAg2 at 40 mK
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE PrInAg2; non-Kramers doublet; electrical resistivity; magnetoresistivity
AB The magneto- (electrical-) resistivity of a Heusler-type intermetallic paramagnetic compound PrInAg2 is measured under high fields up to 12 T at 40 mK (down to 50 mK under zero held). No evidence of any transition is detected under zero field in our sample and deviations of the resistivity can well fit as proportional to + log T function below 1 K down to even 50 mK. The magnetoresistivity is positive at any measuring fields. It seems that the external magnetic field dissolves the anomaly at low temperature via breaking the cubic symmetry. Moreover, the magnetoresistivity varies with + log H from 0.01 T to 1 T and is scaleable to the electrical resistivity via the relation of T proportional to +\ H-n\(n approximate to 2/3). Then both of the anomalies between the magneto- and the electrical-resistivity must be originated from a common source. Thereon, the value of the exponent n does not take 1. i.e. the field effect on the resistivity is not Zeemanian, It has been already known that a Pr3+(4f(2)) ion in the compound is located in cubic symmetry and has a non-magnetic non-Kramers doublet Gamma(3) ground state. It is possible that the anomalies originate from the Gamma(3) ground state. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Physical properties of TmS under pressure
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE TmS; pressure effects; phase diagrams
ID TMTE; VALENCE; STATE
AB The resistivity of TmS has been measured below room temperature under pressure up to 8 GPa. The resistivity increases on cooling having a maximum at a temperature T-MAX just above T-N, at which a small anomaly is observed. T-N and T-MAX increase with pressure. A kink appears at T-1 below T-MAX under 1 GPa, while the anomaly near T-N disappears. Furthermore, the rho-T curve is found to show a hysteresis under P > 5 Cpa at lower temperatures than T-2 below T-1. A pressure-temperature-phase diagram of TmS is proposed from these results. (C) 2000 Published by Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Anomalous magnetoelastic properties of DyB6 under high pressure
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE DyB6; thermal expansion; magnetic susceptibility; high pressure
AB Thermal expansion Delta L/L(T) and magnetic susceptibility chi(T) in various magnetic fields H applied along the [1 1 0] direction of the single-crystalline DyB6 have been investigated under hydrostatic pressures up to 1 GPa, At ambient pressure, it is found that Delta L/L(T) in H = 1 T shows a rapid decrease at T-M ( = 23 K), which is not observed in zero field. As H increases T-M decreases largely and the discontinuous change in Delta L/L at T-M becomes pronounced. On the other hand, no anomalous behavior in chi(T) curves has been observed at T-M BY the application of pressure, the transition at T-M is found to be rapidly suppressed and disappear at high pressure above 0.3 GPa. (C) 2000 Published by Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Effect of pressure on the ferroquadrupolar compound TmAu2
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 51st Yamada Conference on Strongly Correlated Electon Systems
CY AUG 24-28, 1999
CL NAGANO, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn, Nagano City
DE quadrupolar and magnetic phase; pressure effects; electrical resistivity
AB TmAu2 with a simple body-centered tetragonal MoSi2-type structure undergoes an electric transition to a ferroquadrupolar ordered state at T-Q of 7.0 K and a magnetic transition to an antiferomagnetic state at T-N Of 3.2 K, We have measured pressure dependence of electrical resistivity on single-crystalline TmAu2 sample. The results reveal that the T-N decreased with increasing pressure (partial derivative T-N/partial derivative P = - 4.54 mK/kbar), while the T-Q increased with increasing pressure (partial derivative T-Q/partial derivative P = 21.5 mK/kbar). (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Pressure-induced small-moment order in heavy-fermion compounds
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE Kondo lattice; heavy fermion; CeRh2Si2; Ce(Ru0.85Rh0.15)(2)Si-2; small
   moment order; neutron diffraction
ID SPIN-DENSITY-WAVE; NEUTRON-DIFFRACTION; MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES;
   KONDO-LATTICE; CERH2SI2; CERU2SI2; TEMPERATURE; CEPD2SI2
AB We report results of neutron diffraction experiments which have been carried out to study the magnetic response of two heavy-fermion magnets Ce(Ru0.85Rh0.15)(2)Si-2 and CeRh2Si2 to hydrostatic pressure. In CeRh2Si2 we have observed two characteristic features in its staggered magnetization (mu) as a function of the transition temperature (T-N): When the pressure is relatively small, mu is proportional to T-N, while mu decreases more rapidly than T-N does when the pressure is close to the critical magnitude to destroy the antiferromagnetism. A similar behavior of mu and T-N was observed also in Ce(Ru0.85Rh0.15)(2)Si-2. These observations indicate that there are two regimes in the long range order of heavy-fermion magnets, that is, the RKKY- regime and the quasi-particle regime. We discuss these results on the basis of a hypothesis that the magnetism of these systems in the critical pressure region can be assigned to the same category as that of the small-moment order which is widely observed in the metallic Kondo-lattice compounds.

TI Impact of lattice defects on device performance of AlGaAs/GaAs p-HEMTs
SO BEAM INJECTION ASSESSMENT OF MICROSTRUCTURES IN SEMICONDUCTORS, 2000
SE SOLID STATE PHENOMENA
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th International Workshop on Bean Injection Assessment of
   Microstructures in Semiconductors
CY NOV 12-16, 2000
CL FUKUOKA, JAPAN
SP Fukuoka Ind, Sci & Technol Fdn, Mitsubishi Fdn
DE AlGaAs/GaAs p-HEMT; induced electron capture levels; non-ionizing energy
   loss; number of knock-on atoms; radiation damage
AB Results are presented of an extensive study on the radiation induced lattice defects in AlGaAs/GaAs pseudomorphic HEMT (High Electron Mobility Transistor)s and their effect on device performance. The recovery behavior of degraded device performance resulting from isothermal annealing is reported. The radiation source dependence of the degradation of device performance is also reported taking into account the calculations of the number of knock-on atoms (Nd) and the nonionizing energy loss (NIEL). The degradation of the electrical performance of devices increases cy with increasing irradiation fluence. The deep levels induced in the Si-doped Al0.26Ga0.74As donor layer of the HEMTs were studied using deep level transient spectroscopy (DLTS) methods. The electron trap level (Ec - 0.55 eV), which is associated with on As vacancy related defects, was observed in the Si-doped Al0.26Ga0.74As donor layer together with a decrease in the electron carrier density. The induced electron trap levels are thought to be mainly responsible for the decrease of the drain current and effective mobility and for the donor removal. The radiation damage for carbon irradiation is the largest, and it is over three orders of magnitude greater than that for electron irradiation. The radiation source dependence of performance degradation is attributed to the difference of mass and the probability of nuclear collision for the formation of lattice defect.
C1 NEC IC Microcomp Syst Ltd, Kumamoto 8612202, Japan.
   Kumamoto Natl Coll Technol, Kumamoto 8611102, Japan.
   Takasaki JAERI, Takasaki, Gumma 3701292, Japan.
   Kyushu Inst Technol, Fukuoka 8048550, Japan.
   Saitama Univ, Urawa, Saitama 3388570, Japan.
RP Kobayashi, K (reprint author), NEC IC Microcomp Syst Ltd, 2081-24 Mashiki, Kumamoto 8612202, Japan.

TI Scaling behavior in the Ce-based Kondo semiconductors: NQR/NMR
   measurements of CeRhSb and CeNiSn under high pressures
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE-FLUCTUATING COMPOUND; ENERGY-GAP; RESONANCE; PSEUDOGAP
AB The validity of scaling has been straightforwardly investigated in CeRhSb and CeNiSn through the high pressure studies on the nuclear spin-lattice relaxation rate T-1(-1). A universal curve with a characteristic temperature in (T1T)(-1), independent of the applied pressures about 1 GPa, is observed over a broad temperature range including the formation of a magnetic excitation gap. This implies that the gap is given by a characteristic temperature, closely related with the Kondo effect. The universal feature is also verified by the Gruneisen parameters obtained from the thermodynamic and transport properties. [S0163-1829(99)01346-6].

TI Uniaxial-stress induced magnetic order in CeNiSn
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID KONDO SEMIMETAL CENISN; ANTIFERROMAGNETIC CORRELATIONS;
   PRESSURE-DEPENDENCE; HEAVY FERMIONS; ENERGY-GAP; LATTICE; TEMPERATURE;
   BEHAVIOR; CE; YB
AB We report the observation of an unexpected magnetic transition in the Kondo semimetal CeNiSn under uniaxial pressures. For P parallel to a, both the specific heat C and magnetic susceptibility chi decrease steadily with increasing P. By contrast, once P parallel to b and P parallel to c exceed 0.13 GPa, C(T) exhibits a distinct jump at 4 K followed by a peak at 3 K. The concomitant peaking in chi(T) for P parallel to B parallel to c is indicative of an antiferromagnetic transition. [S0163-1829(99)51234-4].

TI Positive magnetoresistivity in a localized-moment ferromagnet with
   itinerant spin fluctuations: TmCo2
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; LAVES PHASE; SYSTEM; FIELD; ORDER; YCO2
AB Results on electrical resistivity and magnetization of TmCo2, intermetallic compound in magnetic fields up to 15 T and in temperature range from 1.5 K to 300 K are presented. In zero magnetic field two well-separated phase transitions are observed at low temperatures: at 3.7 K and at 3.3 K. Magnetoresistivity at temperatures below 3.3 K is negative. However at higher temperatures, magnetoresistivity is positive in a weak field, showing a maximum in the dependence on the magnetic field at H-max. H-max is found to be proportional to T-1.5 The maximum exists also in the temperature dependence of magnetoresistivity, measured at a constant external field H*. The results are interpreted in the framework of a model with two different contributions to magnetoresistivity: a negative one, related to the localized 4f magnetic moments of Tm, and a positive contribution associated with the features of the Co 3d band which are responsible for the itinerant metamagnetism of RCo2 compounds. The positive magnetoresistivity arises due to the spin polarization of the Co 3d band by the exchange field and enhancement of the spin fluctuations within this band. [S0163-1829(99)01425-3].

TI Magnetic phenomena in UNi1-xRhxAl compounds
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
DE UNiAl; URhAl; uranium intermetallics; metamagnetism
ID ELECTRONIC-PROPERTIES; HYBRIDIZATION
AB We report on structure investigation and magnetization study of UN1-xRhxAl solid solutions between an antiferromagnet UNiAl and a ferromagnet URhAl. The ZrNiAl-type hexagonal crystal structure of the parent compounds is preserved in the whole concentration range. Magnetization was measured as a function of magnetic field, temperature and external hydrostatic pressure. The observed complex evolution of magnetic phenomena with Rh substitution for Ni is discussed in terms of effects of the varying Sf-ligand hybridization. A tentative magnetic phase diagram is proposed. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science S.A. All rights reserved.

TI Thermodynamics of the first-order valence transition in YbInCu4
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID KONDO VOLUME-COLLAPSE; PHASE-TRANSITION; PRESSURE; YBXIN1-XCU2; NEUTRON;
   CERIUM; ALLOYS; STATE; CE; YB
AB We present measurements of the specific heat and complete elastic moduli of YbInCu4 as a function of temperature in order to complement existing thermal expansion data. Together these data allow a complete analysis of the thermodynamics of the first-order isostructural valence transition in YbInCu4. The Clausius-Clapeyron equation predicts well the measured pressure dependence of the valence transition temperature. Estimates of the Gruneisen parameter from thermodynamic measurements and from pressure-dependent magnetic susceptibility in both the high-temperature and low-temperature phases of YbInCu4 are in good agreement. On the other hand, a Gruneisen analysis of the change in Kondo temperature at the valence transition fails, emphasizing the importance of carrier-density changes associated with the valence transition, unlike in the case of the gamma-alpha transition in elemental Ce. Finally, we address the issue of precursive rounding in the elastic moduli for temperatures greater than the valence transition temperature and argue that thermodynamically YbInCu4's valence transition is indeed first order. [S0163-1829(98)00526-8].
C1 Univ Calif Los Alamos Natl Lab, Div Mat Sci & Technol, Los Alamos, NM 87545 USA.
   Lucent Technol, Bell Labs, Murray Hill, NJ 07974 USA.
   Florida State Univ, Natl High Magnet Field Lab, Tallahassee, FL 32306 USA.
   Saitama Univ, Dept Phys, Urawa, Saitama 338, Japan.
RP Sarrao, JL (reprint author), Univ Calif Los Alamos Natl Lab, Div Mat Sci & Technol, Los Alamos, NM 87545 USA.

TI Pressure effect on superconducting transition temperature of Ce1-xLaxRu2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism
CY JUL 27-AUG 01, 1997
CL CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA
DE superconductors; phase-transition pressure; structure
ID CERU2
AB The resistivity of CeRu2 was measured under high pressure up to 1 GPa. The pressure dependence of superconducting transition temperature T-c of CeRu2 is negative by a rate of Delta T-c/Delta p = -0.47 K/GPa for p less than or equal to 0.5 GPa and is positive for 0.5 GPa < p less than or equal to 1 GPa by a rate of 0.33 K/GPa. The room temperature resistivity increases after the cooling of the sample down to 4 K for p greater than or equal to 0.6 GPa, indicating a phase transition which induces the change of pressure derivatives of the superconducting transition temperature. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Thermopower of Fe2P in magnetic fields up to 15 T
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism
CY JUL 27-AUG 01, 1997
CL CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA
DE thermopower; magneto-thermopower
ID SINGLE-CRYSTAL
AB Temperature dependencies of thermopower S(T) of Fe2P compound with hexagonal structure have been measured between 2 and 300 K in magnetic fields up to 15 T. S(T) takes a minimum around 20 K and shows a kink at T-C. T-C has a large magnetic field H dependence. The S(T) curve after cooling from room temperature to 2 K in magnetic field of 15 T reveals two characteristic features, the shoulder between 60 and 70 K and the discontinuity at T-C. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

TI Degradation of SiGe devices by proton irradiation
SO RADIATION PHYSICS AND CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Symposium on Advanced Nuclear Energy Research
CY MAR 18-20, 1996
CL TAKASAKI, JAPAN
SP JAERI
ID SEMICONDUCTORS; RADIATION; DAMAGE
AB The degradation and recovery behavior of strained Si1-xGex diodes and heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs) irradiated by protons are studied. The degradation of device performance and the generation of lattice defects are reported as a function of fluence and also compared extensively with previous results obtained on electron and neutron irradiated devices. The radiation source dependence of the degradation is discussed taking into account the number of knock-on atoms and the nonionizing energy loss (NIEL). (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ltd.

TI Magnetoresistance of magnetic multilayers at high pressure
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Workshop on Transition Metals and Compounds under
   Multiextreme Conditions
CY SEP 18-20, 1996
CL KUMAMOTO, JAPAN
HO KUMAMOTO UNIV
DE giant magnetoresistance; magnetic multilayer; high pressure
ID FERMION COMPOUND CEINCU2; GIANT MAGNETORESISTANCE; FE/CR SUPERLATTICES;
   ROUGHNESS; EXCHANGE
AB In the present work we report the effect of pressure on the giant magnetoresistance (GMR) of several magnetic multilayers (MML). First, we show the experimental results of the effect of pressure on the electrical resistance and magnetoresistance (MR) of Fe/Cr MML haying different thickness of Cr layers t(Cr). It is found that the GMR of the samples near the first peak (t(Cr) = 9.5 and 11 A) is affected strongly by applying pressure reflecting the unstable electronic structure but the effect of pressure on the MR of the sample between peaks (t(Cr) = 15.2 Angstrom) is very small. The saturation field H-S of Fe/Cr MML increases with pressure. These results are compared with those of other MMLs such as Fe/Cu and Co/Cu systems. Finally, the importance of the magnetic state in the paramagnetic layers or interfacial roughness is pointed out to understand the results in the present work.
C1 ARIAKE NATL COLL TECHNOL,OMUTA,FUKUOKA 836,JAPAN.

TI Effect of pressure on the Kondo compound CeRhSb
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Workshop on Transition Metals and Compounds under
   Multiextreme Conditions
CY SEP 18-20, 1996
CL KUMAMOTO, JAPAN
HO KUMAMOTO UNIV
DE CeRhSb; Kondo compound; high pressure
ID GAP
AB CeRhSb crystallizes in the orthorhombic epsilon-TiNiSi-type structure. It has been shown that CeRhSb is a semiconductor type valence fluctuating compound such as Ce3Pt4Bi3. In the present work we measured the electrical resistivity and magnetoresistance of CeRhSb in the ranges, pressure P, 0 less than or equal to P less than or equal to 8 GPa, temperature T, 2.0 K less than or equal to T less than or equal to 300 K, and magnetic field H, 0 less than or equal to H less than or equal to 5 T. At 1 bar, rho(T) of CeRhSb shows a minimum (T-min) at 7.8 K, which may reflects opening of an energy gap. T-min increases with pressure and has a broad maximum centered near 4 GPa. The pressure dependence of T-min indicates that the gap disappears at pressures between 7 and 8 GPa. The magnetoresistance below 5 T is large and T positive under pressure up to 2.3 GPa.

TI Thermal expansion of CeRhSb under high pressure
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Workshop on Transition Metals and Compounds under
   Multiextreme Conditions
CY SEP 18-20, 1996
CL KUMAMOTO, JAPAN
HO KUMAMOTO UNIV
DE CeRhSb; thermal expansion; high pressure
ID COMPOUND
AB The linear thermal expansion of polycrystalline CeRhSb has been measured in the temperature range 77 K < T < 300 K under hydrostatic pressure up to 2.3 GPa. It is found that the thermal expansion coefficient alpha(T) at ambient pressure shows a maximum around T-max = 140 K and T-max increases with increasing pressure having rate of partial derivative T-max/partial derivative P = + 38.5 K/GPa. This fact shows that the Kondo temperature T-K is increased by applying pressure.

TI Magnetic properties of single crystal (Fe1-xRux)(2)P
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5th International Conference / 45th Yamada Conference on Physics of
   Transition Metals (ICPTM 96)
CY SEP 24-27, 1996
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
DE (Fe1-xRux)(2)P; magnetization; phase diagram; single crystal
ID ANTIFERROMAGNETISM; FERROMAGNETISM; FE2P
AB The magnetizations of single crystal (Fe1-xRux)(2)P have been measured as a function of temperature (T) from 5 to 300 K and magnetic field (H) up to 5.5 T. It is found that the substitution of Ru for Fe leads to the antiferromagnetic state for 0.02 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 0.06, and above x = 0.06, the magnetic state changes to ferromagnetism again.

TI Effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity and magnetization of
   CeScGe
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5th International Conference / 45th Yamada Conference on Physics of
   Transition Metals (ICPTM 96)
CY SEP 24-27, 1996
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
DE CeScGe; pressure effect; magnetization; electrical resistivity
AB Measurement of the magnetization up to H = 30 T at 4.2 K, temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility and effect of pressure on the electrical resistivity on CeScGe are presented. These results indicate that CeScGe is antiferromagnetic with T-N = 46 K. The Neel temperature T-N decreases with increasing pressure with the rate of dT(N)/dP = -0.56 K/kbar.

TI Magnetoresistance of ErNi2B2C under high pressure
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5th International Conference / 45th Yamada Conference on Physics of
   Transition Metals (ICPTM 96)
CY SEP 24-27, 1996
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
DE ErNi2B2C; magnetoresistance; high pressure; borocarbide
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; MAGNETISM
AB The transverse magnetoresistance (MR) of ErNi2B2C at 4.2K has been measured in the field direction parallel and perpendicular to the c-axis (H parallel to c and H perpendicular to c) under high pressure up to 2.2 GPa. It is found that the upper critical field H-c2 is anisotropic and decreases with increasing pressure having a rate of dH(c2)/dP = -0.02 T/GPa and -0.01 T/GPa for H parallel to c and H perpendicular to c, respectively. For H perpendicular to c, metamagnetic transition occurs at H' = 2T and H' increase with pressure with +0.1T/GPa.

TI Degradation and recovery of proton irradiated Si1-xGex epitaxial devices
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NUCLEAR SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 33rd Annual IEEE International Nuclear and Space Radiation Effects
   Conference
CY JUL 15-19, 1996
CL INDIAN WELLS, CA
SP IEEE NPSS, Def Nucl Agcy, Sandia Natl Labs, Phillips Labs, NASA, Goddard Space Flight Lab, Jet Prop Lab
HO RENAISSANCE ESMERALD CONFERENCE RESORT
ID DOPED SILICON; DAMAGE; RADIATION
AB Irradiation damage in n(+)-Si/p(+)-Si1-xGex/n-Si epitaxial diodes and heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs) by protons is studied as a function of germanium content, proton fluence and energy for the first time. The degradation of the electrical performance of devices increases with increasing fluence, while it decreases with increasing germanium content and energy. The induced lattice defects in the Si1-xGex epitaxial layers and the Si substrate are studied by DLTS methods. In the Si1-xGex epitaxial layers for diodes, electron capture levels associated with interstitial boron complex are induced by irradiation, while two electron capture levels corresponding to the E center and the divacancy are observed in the collector region of the HBTs. The influence of the radiation source on device degradation is then discussed taking into account the number of knock-on atoms and the nonionizing energy loss (NIEL). The radiation source dependence of performance degradation is attributed to the difference of mass and the probability of nuclear collision for the formation of lattice defects. In order to examine the recovery behavior, isochronal thermal annealing is carried out for temperatures ranging from 75 to 300 degrees C. Based on the recovery of electrical performance, it is pointed out that the electron capture levels induced in the Si1-xGex epitaxial layers are mainly responsible for the increase of reverse diode current.
C1 IMEC,B-3001 LOUVAIN,BELGIUM.
   RIKKYO UNIV,YOKOSUKA,KANAGAWA 24001,JAPAN.
   TAKASAKI JAERI,TAKASAKI,GUMMA 37012,JAPAN.

TI Proton irradiation effects on the performance of Si1-xGex devices
SO PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI A-APPLIED RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article
ID SILICON; DAMAGE; RADIATION
AB Irradiation damage in n(+)-Si/p(+)-Si1-xGex/n-Si epitaxial diodes and heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs) by protons is studied as a function of germanium content, proton fluence and energy for the first time. The degradation of the electrical performance of devices increases with increasing fluence: while it decreases with increasing germanium content and energy. The induced lattice defects in the Si1-xGex epitaxial layers and the Si substrate are studied by DLTS methods. In the Si1-xGex epitaxial layers for diodes, electron capture levels associated with interstitial-substitutional boron complex are induced by irradiation, while two electron capture levels corresponding to the E center and the divacancy are observed in the collector region of the HBTs. The influence of the radiation source on device degradation is then discussed taking into account the number of knock-on atoms and the nonionizing energy loss (NIEL). The radiation source dependence of performance degradation is attributed to the difference of mass and the probability of nuclear collision for the formation of lattice defects.

TI Degradation of Si1-xGex epitaxial devices by proton irradiation
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID DAMAGE; RADIATION
AB Irradiation damage in n(+)-Si/p(+)-Si1-xGex/n-Si epitaxial diodes and heterojunction bipolar transistors by protons is studied. The degradation of the performance increases with increasing proton fluence, whereas it decreases with increasing germanium content and proton energy. The damage coefficient for proton irradiation is nearly the same as for neutron irradiation and is about three orders of magnitude larger than that for electron irradiation. This difference is due to the different number of knock-on atoms and the nonionizing energy loss, which is correlated to the difference of mass and the possibility of nuclear collisions. (C) 1996 American Institute of Physics.

TI Effect of pressure on the Neel temperature of CePd2Ge2
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems (SCES
   95)
CY SEP 27-30, 1995
CL GOA, INDIA
SP Tata Inst Fundamental Res, Bombay
ID ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY; MAGNETORESISTANCE
AB Electrical resistance of the Kondo compound CePd(2)Ge(2) has been measured under high pressure at low temperature in order to examine the competition between the magnetism and Kondo effect. It is found that the Neel temperature T(N) increases with increasing pressure and this compound is placed on the left-hand side of the peak of the Doniach's phase diagram. The result is discussed by comparing with the previous result of La-substitution.

TI Thermal expansion of YbCu4Ag and YbCu4Au
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th European Magnetic Materials and Applications Conference (EMMA 95)
CY SEP 04-08, 1995
CL VIENNA, AUSTRIA
HO TU VIENNA
DE Kondo lattice; intermediate valence; thermal expansion
ID VALENCE COMPOUNDS; BEHAVIOR; YBXCU4
AB Thermal expansion Delta L/L was measured on the isostructural compounds YbCu4Ag and YbCu4Au. It was found that for YbCu4Ag the thermal expansion coefficient alpha(T) exhibits a pronounced negative minimum around 25 K. In contrast, alpha(T) of YbCu4Au is positive and increases at low temperatures.

TI Pressure-induced decoupling of the magnetic ordering of the Mn and Gd
   sublattices in GdMn2
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICS-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID TBMN2 INTERMETALLIC COMPOUND; MOMENT INSTABILITY; RARE-EARTH; YMN2;
   DEPENDENCE; STATE; DYMN2; HOMN2; ERMN2
AB The thermal expansion of GdMn2 was measured under pressures up to 20 kbar. The large positive magnetovolume effect, caused by the onset of the Mn magnetism, is found to be shifted towards lower temperatures with pressure, and vanishes around 15 kbar. Above this pressure only the Gd sublattice shows long-range magnetic order. Between 6 and 15 kbar the Gd and Mn sublattices order separately. The pressure-induced splitting of the ordering temperatures is ascribed to the Mn magnetism instability, which is observed for certain RMn(2) compounds.
C1 MOSCOW MV LOMONOSOV STATE UNIV,DEPT PHYS,MOSCOW 119899,RUSSIA.
   VIENNA TECH UNIV,INST EXPTL PHYS,A-1040 VIENNA,AUSTRIA.

TI Anomalous pressure dependence of giant magnetoresistance in magnetic
   superlattice
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2nd International Symposium on Metallic Multilayers (MML 95)
CY SEP 11-14, 1995
CL CAMBRIDGE, ENGLAND
HO CAVENDISH LAB
ID FE/CR
AB The magnetoresistance (MR) of Fe/Cr, Co/Cu and Fe/Cu magnetic superlattices (SL) has been measured at 4.2 K under high pressure up to 2 GPa. It is found that MR of magnetic SL decreases with increasing pressure but different behaviour is observed between Fe/Cr and Fe/Cu or Co/Cu SL. Such a difference is also found in the pressure dependence of the saturation field H-s. The origin of the difference is discussed briefly.

TI Effect of pressure on the superconductivity of HoNi2B2C
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Workshop on Advances in High Magnetic Fields (AHMF 95)
CY FEB 20-22, 1995
CL TSUKUBA, JAPAN
SP Sci & Technol Agcy, Japan Int Sci & Technol Exchange Ctr
HO NATL RES INST MET
AB The electrical resistance of a single crystal of the magnetic superconductor HoNi2B2C has been measured as a function of temperature (T) and magnetic field (H) under high pressure (P). It is found that the superconducting transition temperature T-C decreases with increasing pressure with dT(C)/dP = - 0.05 K/kbar and the antiferromagnetic transition temperature T-N increases with dT(N)/dP = 0.07 K/kbar. As T-C approaches T-N, the interplay between these two transitions manifests itself as an increased broadening of the superconducting transition.

TI GIANT MAGNETORESISTANCE OF CO/CU SUPERLATTICE UNDER HIGH-PRESSURE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
AB The magnitude of giant magnetoresistance (GMR) of the (Co10 Angstrom/Cu10 Angstrom)(15) superlattice has been measured up to 20 kbar. It is found that the electrical resistivity rho decreases with increasing pressure at room temperature, having the rate rho(-1)partial derivative rho/partial derivative P = -22 X 10(-3) kbar(-1). The magnetoresistance (MR) ratio Delta rho/rho(s) at 4.2 g slightly decreases with increasing pressure. The saturation field H-s also decreases with increasing pressure.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF KONDO
   COMPOUND CENIXGA4-X
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
ID ALLOYS
AB Thermal expansion coefficients of CeNixGa4-x (x = 0.75, 0.875 and 1.1) have been measured in the temperature range from 4.2 to 300 K and at high pressure up to 20 kbar for x = 1.1. It is found for x = 1.1 that the coefficient A(T = 10 K) of the T-linear term in alpha(T) is larger than those of other samples and decreases with increasing pressure.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY OF CEPTSI2
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th Rare Earth Research Conference
CY SEP 12-17, 1993
CL MONTEREY, CA
SP RARE EARTH RES CONF INC, SAN JOSE STATE UNIV
ID VALENCE INSTABILITY; KONDO; STATE; CEINCU2
AB Electrical resistivity rho(T) of the concentrated Kondo compound CePtSi, has been measured as a function of temperature at, various pressures up to 80 kbar. Two maxima are observed near 5 K (= T1) and 28 K (= T2) in the rho(T) curve. at ambient pressure. It is found that T2 increases with increasing pressure but T1 disappears above 5 kbar and the two maxima are merged into a broad maximum above 20 kbar. The overall behavior of the rho(T) curves at high pressures indicates that a crossover in the electronic state of CePtSi2 is induced by applying pressure. On the basis of the data in the present work, we examine a semi-quantitative analysis to obtain the value of \JN(0)\ at ambient pressure.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE RESISTIVITY IN CERHSB
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems (SCES
   93)
CY AUG 16-19, 1993
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, INST PURE & APPL PHYS SCI, UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, AMER PHYS SCI, INST MECH & MAT, INT SCI FDN, WASHINGTON, DC, LOS ALAMOS NATL LAB, NATL HIGH MAGNET FIELD LAB, US DOE, US NATL SCI FDN
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID GAP
AB The resistivity of the Kondo insulator CeRhSb has been measured from 1.8 K to room temperature under hydrostatic pressures up to 23 kbar. The characteristic temperature for the valence fluctuations and the gap energy at low temperature increase with increasing pressure. The magnetoresistance has also been measured under various pressures at 4.2 K. The magnetoresistance is large and positive under some pressures up to 23 kbar to magnetic fields below 5 T.

TI MAGNETISM IN CERU2GE2 AND CERH2GE2 AND ITS PRESSURE-DEPENDENCE
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems (SCES
   93)
CY AUG 16-19, 1993
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, INST PURE & APPL PHYS SCI, UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, AMER PHYS SCI, INST MECH & MAT, INT SCI FDN, WASHINGTON, DC, LOS ALAMOS NATL LAB, NATL HIGH MAGNET FIELD LAB, US DOE, US NATL SCI FDN
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID HEAVY; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; URU2SI2
AB We have studied magnetism in CeRu2Ge2 and CeRh2Ge2 through specific heat in zero and applied magnetic fields, DC magnetization, thermal expansion and electrical resistance measurements at pressures to 21 kbar. Both compounds have two magnetic transitions; although we argue that the higher one in CeRu2Ge2 is due to residual stress in the polycrystalline sample. The overall systematics are consistent with those found at ambient pressure in pseudoternaries formed with Si substitution for Ge.
C1 KUMAMOTO UNIV,KUMAMOTO 860,JAPAN.
   TIFR,BOMBAY,INDIA.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF CENI0.8PT0.2
   AND CE0.8Y0.2NI0.8PT0.2
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID CEXY1-XNI0.8PT0.2
AB Thermal expansion coefficients of CeNi0.8Pt0.2 and Ce0.8Y0.2Ni0.8Pt0.2 polycrystalline samples have been measured up to 19 kbar in the temperature range from 7 to 250 K. The evolution of these coefficients with pressure is analysed and interpreted as a consequence of the increasing hybridization of the 4f electron with the conduction band.

TI GIANT MAGNETORESISTANCE OF FE/CR SUPERLATTICES UNDER HIGH-PRESSURE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON METALLIC MULTILAYERS ( MML 93 )
CY MAR 01-05, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN INST MET, RES INST PROD DEV
ID EXCHANGE
AB Magnetoresistance (MR) of Fe/Cr superlattices having different Cr thickness t(Cr) has been measured under high pressure up to 20 kbar. It is found that the effect of pressure on MR depends on t(Cr) MR of the sample having t(Cr) near the first MR peak (t(Cr) almost-equal-to 11 angstrom) decreases more rapidly than those existing between the first and second MR peak (t(Cr) almost-equal-to 25 angstrom).

TI THERMAL-EXPANSION AND EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY
   OF A NEW DENSE KONDO COMPOUND CEPTSI2
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE INSTABILITY; LOW-TEMPERATURES; CEINCU2
AB The electrical resistivity rho(T) of CePtSi2 has been measured up to 20 kbar. It is found that two maxima exist in rho(T) at ambient pressure but merge into a broad peak above 10 kbar. The thermal expansion coefficient alpha(T) is also measured at ambient pressure. A large enhancement in alpha/T is observed at low temperature.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF CENI
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Thermal expansion coefficients (alpha) of a CeNi single crystal have been measured up to 13.7 kbar in the temperature range 4.2 K < T < 300 K. It is found that alpha along the c-axis has a maximum at 75 K due to the crystalline electric field (CEF) splitting of the 4f level of the Ce3+-ion and the maximum decreases with increasing pressure.

TI ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY AND EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION
   OF A SINGLE-CRYSTAL OF YBCU2SI2
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Electrical resistivity rho(T) and thermal expansion DELTAl/l were measured for the intermediate valence compound (IVC) YbCu2Si2 and its counterpart LuCu2Si2 between 4.2 K and 300 K. It was found that the thermal expansion coefficient alpha(T) has a negative minimum around 31 K (= T(min)) at atmospheric pressure and T(min) decreases with increasing pressure at the rate partial derivative T(min)/partial derivative T = -0.45 K/kbar.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON MAGNETIC TRANSITIONS IN UNIGA
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The influence of hydrostatic pressure up to 10 kbar on magnetic phase transitions in UNiGa was studied by means of studying electrical resistivity anomalies. The results indicate that the antiferromagnetic interactions along the c-axis of the hexagonal structure are promoted by pressure.

TI THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENTS OF MIXED-VALENCE COMPOUND CE1-XLAXNI
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF : RARE EARTHS 92
CY JUN 01-05, 1992
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP CHEM SOC JAPAN, JAPAN INST MET, JAPAN SOC ANAL CHEM, ELECTROCHEM SOC JAPAN, CERAM SOC JAPAN, SOC SYNTHET ORGANIC CHEM JAPAN, JAPAN SOC NEWER MET, PHYS SOC JAPAN, JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, KINKI CHEM SOC
AB The thermal expansion coefficients of single crystals of the mixed valence compound Ce1-xLaxNi (x = 0, 0.5 and 1.0) have been measured in the temperature range 4.2 < T < 300 K. A large anisotropy is found in the temperature dependence of the thermal expansion coefficients (alpha(i) - T curves, where i = a, b or c axis) for these compounds. A broad maximum due to crystal electric field splitting is observed in alpha(v)(T) for CeNi but not for Ce0.5La0.5Ni. A brief analysis is done for the low temperature part of the alpha(i) - T curves.

TI METAMAGNETISM IN TBNI2SI2 SINGLE-CRYSTAL
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE METAMAGNETISM; TBNI2SI2; CRYSTAL FIELD EFFECT; MAGNETIC STRUCTURE
ID DEVILS STAIRCASE; MAGNETIC-STRUCTURES; RARE-EARTH; NEUTRON; FIELD; CESB
AB We studied magnetic properties in the TbNi2Si2 single crystal compound by magnetic and neutron diffraction measurements. The magnetic moments born on only Tb are fixed to the c-axis due to a strong crystalline electric effect. The compound undergoes a commensurate-incommensurate phase transition at T(t) = 7.9 K; the commensurate phase with k=[1/2, 1/2, 0] is stable below T(t), and above T(t), the incommensurate one with k=[1/2+tau, 1/2-tau,0] (tau=0.074) appears and persists up to T(N)=14.6 K. A multi-step metamagnetic transition was found in the low temperature c-axis magnetization process in which at least nine magnetic phases appear. This process is a typical example of ''the devil's staircase'' in real compounds.
C1 HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 730,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   SAITAMA UNIV,FAC SCI,URAWA,SAITAMA 338,JAPAN.
RP SHIGEOKA, T (reprint author), YAMAGUCHI UNIV,FAC SCI,YAMAGUCHI 753,JAPAN.

   BAK P, 1982, REP PROG PHYS, V45, P587, DOI 10.1088/0034-4885/45/6/001
   BARANDIARAN JM, 1987, J MAGN MAGN MATER, V69, P61, DOI 10.1016/0304-8853(87)90212-5
   BLANCO JA, 1991, J MAGN MAGN MATER, V97, P4, DOI 10.1016/0304-8853(91)90154-3
   COWLEY RA, 1991, PHYS REV LETT, V66, P1521, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevLett.66.1521

TI THE EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE NEEL TEMPERATURE OF URU2SI2
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID MONOCRYSTALLINE URU2SI2; UBE13
AB The temperature dependence of the electrical resistivity of the intermetallic compound URu2Si2 was measured up to 80 kbar in order to examine the stability of the antiferromagnetic state at high pressures.  It was found that the Neel temperature T(N) (approximately 17 K at 1 bar) increases with increasing pressure at a rate of about 0.2 K kbar-1 below 20 kbar.  The increase in T(N) becomes very sluggish at high pressures (above 50 kbar), with a broad maximum around 80 kbar.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENTS OF CECU2
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
AB The thermal expansion coefficient alpha of the concentrated Kondo compound CeCu2 has been measured at high pressure up to 20 kbar in order to get information about the influence of pressure on the magnetic contribution to alpha, alpha(mag), and the effective mass m* of the electrons.  It is found that alpha(mag) and m* decrease with increasing pressure.  Alpha(v)(mag)(T) is discussed, in relation to the effect of crystalline electric field splitting, using a simple theoretical model.

HO UNIV AMSTERDAM
ID SUPERCONDUCTOR URU2SI2
AB The effects of pressure and magnetic field on the electrical resistivity of the heavy fermion compound URu2Si2 have been measured up to 20 kbar and 5 T.  It is found that T(N) increases with pressure and the magnetoresistance shows a complicated behavior with pressure.

TI ANOMALOUS THERMAL-EXPANSION OF CE(RU1-XRHX)2SI2 UNDER HIGH-PRESSURE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SYMP AT THE INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM : HEAVY FERMIONS
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID CERU2SI2
AB Thermal expansion coefficients alpha(T) of single-crystalline Ce(Ru1-xRhx2Si2(x = 0.03, 0.1) have been measured under pressure up to 20 kbar in the temperature range, 2 < T < 300 K.  It is found that the temperature (= T(m)) of alpha-maximum of x = 0.03, which may be around 2 K at 1 bar, increases largely with increasing pressure and the anomaly at T(m) tends to disappear at high pressure.  A minimum in the alpha(T) curve of x = 0.03 is observed around 70 K at 1 bar, which is attributed to the negative contribution of crystal electric field splitting to alpha.  The minimum disappears by applying pressure.  The results will be discussed in connection with Kondo effect and crystal electric field splitting.
C1 KUMAMOTO UNIV,FAC GEN EDUC,DEPT PHYS,KUMAMOTO 860,JAPAN.
   OSAKA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

TI THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENTS OF CERH2-XNIXSI2 ALLOYS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SYMP AT THE INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM : HEAVY FERMIONS
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID LOW-TEMPERATURES; SOLIDS
AB Thermal expansion coefficients of polycrystalline CeRh2-xNixSi2 have been measured in the temperature range from 4.2 to 300 K.  It is found that the antiferromagnetic ordering temperature T(N)(K) of x = 0 is higher than that of x = 0.1 and no ordering appears above x = 0.2.  The pseudoternary system CeRh2-xNixSi2 shows a crossover from magnetic heavy fermion state to mixed valence state via nonmagnetic heavy fermion state by changing x.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT IN CENISN
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
ID GAP
AB Thermal expansion coefficient of CeNiSn single-crystal has been measured up to 8 kbar in the temperature range from 4.2 to 300 K. The thermal expansion coefficients alpha(i) (i = a, b and c) of CeNiSn are highly anisotropic. Around T = 50 K, we observed extremely mysterious anomaly in the alpha(i)(T) at 1 bar, which disappears at 8 kbar. Both alpha(a) and alpha(b) at 1 bar sharply decrease below 7 K, which originates in the opening of an anisotropic energy gap. However, this anomaly also disappears at 8 kbar.

TI X-RAY-DIFFRACTION STUDY OF THE STRUCTURAL-CHANGE IN CEZN UNDER
   HIGH-PRESSURE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
AB X-ray diffraction studies at high pressure up to 100 kbar have been performed on a Kondo compound CeZn at room temperature. A pressure induced cubic-rhombohedral structural transition occurs at 26 kbar. No anomaly is detected in the compression curve around the phase transition.

   ONUKI, Y
TI THERMAL-EXPANSION OF SINGLE CRYSTALLINE KONDO COMPOUND CECU2
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID HEAT
AB Thermal expansion measurement has been carried out on single crystalline CeCu2 and YCu2 in the temperature range from 1.8 K to 300 K.  The thermal expansions of CeCu2 are highly anisotropic among each crystal axis reflecting orthorhombic crystal structure.  A well-defined anomaly due to antiferromagnetic ordering is observed near 3.5 K in the temperature dependence of the linear thermal expansion coefficient alpha-i (i = a-, b- and c-axis).  A magnetic contribution to alpha-i(T) due to 4f electron is estimated by comparing the alpha-i-T curve of CeCu2 with that of YCu2.  We also discuss the magnetic contribution to volume thermal expansion alpha-v(T) curve and attempt to analyze it on the basis of phenomenological theory.

RP UWATOKO, Y (reprint author), KUMAMOTO UNIV,FAC GEN EDUC,DEPT PHYS,KUMAMOTO 860,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF THE HEAVY
   FERMION MATERIAL CECU2SI2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
AB Thermal expansion coefficient alpha(T) of the heavy fermion material CeCu2Si2 has been measured in the temperature range from 3 to 300 K under high pressures up to 15 kbar.  A large enhancement in the value of alpha/T was found at low temperatures and alpha/T at 0 K decreased with increasing pressure.
C1 KUMAMOTO UNIV,FAC GEN EDUC,DEPT PHYS,KUMAMOTO 680,JAPAN.
   UNIV TSUKUBA,INST MAT SCI,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI ANISOTROPIC THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF THE KONDO COMPOUND CECU2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB The thermal expansion of single crystalline CeCu2 has been measured by using strain gauge method in the temperature range from 4.2 to 300 K.  The influences of Kondo effect and crystal electric field splitting on the thermal expansion coefficient are discussed.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE THERMAL-EXPANSION COEFFICIENT OF URU2SI2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID SYSTEM URU2SI2; HEAVY
AB Thermal expansion coefficient of the intermetallic compound URu2Si2 has been measured at high pressures up to 20 kbar in order to get information about the effect of pressure on the Neel-temperature T(N) and the effective mass m*.  T(N) is found to increase with increasing pressure having a rate partial-T(N)/partial-P = 0.49 K/kbar.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST MAT SCI,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RP IKI, K (reprint author), KUMAMOTO UNIV,FAC GEN EDUC,DEPT PHYS,KUMAMOTO 860,JAPAN.
